name: Buckwheat Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: Rinse buckwheat under cold water and cook according to package instructions (typically simmering in water for about 15 minutes).
While buckwheat is cooking, heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and saut√© for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add sliced carrots and stir-fry for about 5 minutes until they begin to soften.
Add peas and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Once the buckwheat is cooked, drain any excess water and add it to the skillet.
Pour in soy sauce, season with salt and pepper, and stir everything together until well combined and heated through.

name: Carrot and Pea Buckwheat Salad
instructions: Cook buckwheat according to package instructions (usually simmering in water for about 15 minutes), then drain and let it cool.
In a large bowl, combine the grated carrots and peas.
Once the buckwheat has cooled, add it to the bowl with the carrots and peas.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve chilled or at room temperature.
